backtracking.name: Backtracking - Generate Subsets
backtracking.description: Generate all possible subsets of a list of integers using backtracking. Return a list of all subsets in any order.

backtracking.name: Backtracking - Subsets With Duplicates
backtracking.description: Generate all unique subsets from a list of integers that may contain duplicates. Avoid generating duplicate subset combinations.

backtracking.name: Backtracking - Permutations
backtracking.description: Generate all permutations of a list of integers using backtracking. Return a list of all possible reorderings.

backtracking.name: Backtracking - Combinations
backtracking.description: Generate all size-k combinations from the numbers 1 through n using backtracking. Return a list of all valid combinations.
backtracking.signature: def combinations(n: int, k: int) -> List[List[int]]:

backtracking.name: Backtracking - Combination Sum
backtracking.description: Given a list of positive integers and a target sum, return all unique combinations where the chosen numbers sum to the target. Numbers may be reused.
backtracking.signature: def combination_sum(candidates: List[int], target: int) -> List[List[int]]:

backtracking.name: Backtracking - Combination Sum II
backtracking.description: Given a list of positive integers (with duplicates) and a target sum, return all unique combinations where each number may be used at most once and sums to the target.
backtracking.signature: def combination_sum_ii(candidates: List[int], target: int) -> List[List[int]]:
